intro: Cordylanthus tenuifolius, commonly known as slenderleaf filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its slender leaves and compact growth habit make it a distinctive species within its native range.
